title: India's Archers Strike Gold at World Archery Championships:  Double Triumph for Deotale and Swami
content:
India made history at the World Archery Championships in Berlin, securing their first-ever individual gold medals in the compound events.  Aditi Gopichand Swami, the 17-year-old prodigy,  dominated the women's final, dropping only one point en route to a 149-147 victory over Mexico's Andrea Becerra.  

Later, Ojas Pravin Deotale, the 21-year-old sensation,  clinched the men's compound title with a perfect score of 150, defeating Poland's Lukasz Przybylski 150-149.  Deotale's performance highlighted the remarkable talent of India's new generation of archers, who have risen to the top of the world stage. 

The tournament also saw Jyothi Surekha Vennam, a seasoned veteran, secure the bronze medal in the women's compound event. India's impressive performance at the World Archery Championships marks a new chapter in the country's archery history and promises an exciting future for the sport in India.
author: Scroll Staff
